line.en: 'I thought you might be here.'
'Yoru.'
'If you don't go back now, you'll be late for\ndinner.'
'Yeah... but, can I stay a little longer?'
'There's no use waiting, it won't appear, you\nknow.'
'Huh? How do you know that?'

'It hasn't flown once since that time, has it? I
went to take a look at the runway but it's
overgrown with weeds and there are no signs of it
having been used.'
'Yeah... but...'
'Uhhhh...'
'Sheesh...'
'I asked about it today at school.'
'It was the members of the Soaring Club at our\nschool.'
'Huh? The people flying in the glider were...?'
'Yes.'
'They were performing club activities. It's\nsimpler to look for them at the more common\nareas.'
'...so that means, if I ask, they might let me\njoin?'
'That's too bad.'
'Huh?'
'The Soaring Club had its status revoked. The\nso-called 'Legendary Senpai' quit, and that was\nit.'
'Really...?'
'That's why they're not flying. So that's why\nthere's no point waiting here.'
'Come on, let's go back. I'm hungry.'
'I see... So they won't be flying anymore...'
A sky so blue, it almost hurts the eyes, and a\ntowering thunderhead.
Cicadas are singing their hearts out. Lush\nvegetation is growing, bathed in the sunlight.
Summer has come again!!
'It's so hot...'
I complain, while hanging the sheets on the\nclothesline.
'In this heat, they should be dry by lunchtime.'
As I speak, I gaze at the distant thunderhead.
It's said that thunderheads, or giant\ncumulonimbus clouds, can extend upwards out of\nthe stratosphere.
The world record for highest flight in a glider\nalso went beyond the stratosphere.
They both seem hard to believe at first.
'Morning.'
As I take the sheets out of the wash basket, I\nhear a voice from behind. It's Ageha.
'It's hot today too, isn't it?'
'I'll be with you in a moment. Can you wait\ninside?'
'Is it here!?'
'Good mor...'
'...Whoa, what are you all doing here?'
'What? It's Ageha...'
'Whew... I was so excited...'
'What is this? Why are you all so disappointed??'
'It'll be here soon...'
'...What will be?'
'The new refrigerator!!'
'Aoi's been trying really hard.'
'We didn't think we'd be able to do it\nourselves.'
'We don't need to compete to keep our juice cool\nanymore.'
'Oh.'
'Our refrigerator has been used for decades, and\nis a relic from the last century.'
'It's been in bad condition for a long time, and\nwe often find that it has no power.'
'But with this, tragic accidents where our\nexpensive ice cream melts on us, will also go\naway...!!'
'A few days ago, Kotori's Haagen-Dazs was\ncompletely ruined...'
'That really is a tragedy.'
'The food won't be spoiled anymore, and the\nelectric bill will be cheaper.'
'And it won't be a problem for the owner,\neither.'
I finished hanging up the laundry, and then while\njoining everyone, I explained.
'She didn't give it the okay right away, though,\ndid she?'
'Yeah, well...'
I was the one who approached the owner about it,\nbut it wasn't exactly a smooth process to get to\nthis point.

The owner herself was okay with it, but her sons
want to get rid of this place as soon as
possible, and that's why they were against the
idea of getting a new fridge.
I persistently pursued the negotiations, and\nfinally won out.
'It's all thanks to Aoi.'
'Yeah, he's a great dorm mother!'
'Nah, not really...'
'The old lady said that Aoi is doing a good job.'
When she says 'old lady', she means the owner.
'I think that's the reason she agreed to it.'
Then, the doorbell rang.
'It's here!'
All the boarders were getting excited.
'Hello there.'
The guy from the electronics store came straight\nin and when he saw all the girls standing there\n(plus one boy) he said, 'Whoa'.
'...Refrigerator delivery.'
'Please install it over here. Could you also take\naway the old one?'
The new fridge will be installed in the dining\nhall, and the old one will be taken away for\nrecycling.
I sign the receipt, then...
'I'll leave the rest to you.'
'Sure.'
I let Kanako take care of it and then I left the\ndormitory.
'Aoi, we'll miss the train.'
'Okay, sorry.'
'It must be nice for them. I wanted to go too,'
grumbled Kotori.
'I can't believe they would go without their\nleader.'
'It can't be helped. Today, you have to help out\nat An-chan's place.'
'I know that.'
It's been a year since the Soaring Club lost its\nstatus.
Then, summer had come around again.
'We've got to hurry up with our plan.'
'Yeah.'
Our revival of the club's activities hadn't been\naccepted, so we still had the status of a\nsociety...
Under the supervision of Tobioka, it had become\neffectively impossible to carry out our club\nactivities in the school grounds.

Just now, Kotori had patronizingly referred to
herself as 'club leader'. She was the second in
charge before, so naturally she inherited the
title.
Anyway, we've been demoted to the status of a\nsociety. So now, she's just the 'leader'.
It looks like Kotori has really taken a liking to\nthat title.
It's weird, but doesn't 'leader' sound a lot more\nhigh and mighty than 'club leader'?
That's kind of beside the point, but we don't\nhave a clubhouse or a glider.
But there are things that we can do.
One of those is working at a part-time job.
Even after the owner got better, I carried on as\nthe the dorm mother.
My mom pays me for the work, and the money is\nused for my living expenses.
Ageha and Kotori are working at An-chan's\nfactory.
They don't receive wages, but they get paid in\nglider materials.
Factories can get those materials more cheaply,\nand they chose good quality materials, which is a\nbig help.
We have a plan coming up that requires the use of\nlarge amounts of FRP and so on.
Ageha and I are heading to the site of another of\nour activities now.
It's at a runway two hours away by train.
I go there often to attend glider flight\ntraining...
A few days ago, I finally managed to get the\npilot's license that I'd wanted for so long!
It was pretty hard work, but with this, I can fly\na glider by myself!
Ageha's been coming with me when she has spare\ntime, to be in contact with the aircraft and help\nwith the maintenance.
Kotori comes too but she always just comes to\nwatch.
She could go for a flight with a local pilot, but\nshe stubbornly refused.
...It's okay. I'll fly with Aoi.
It seems she still remembers the promise I made\nto her before. Of course, I secretly still\nremember it too.
We had a goal.
To complete an aircraft according to the designs\nthat Amane had left behind.
Then, to fly that glider through the passage of\nclouds.
'Compared to past data, the weather conditions\nthis year are similar to those of years when\nMorning Glories occurred.'
'It could come this summer.'
'It's possible.'
We don't know if it'll come or not.
It came last year, so it's more natural to think\nthat it won't come again this year too.
But...
'It's no use thinking about it not coming. Let's\nbelieve that it will come, and keep going.'
'That's why we need to make all the necessary\npreparations.'
I look up to see a sky so blue, that it almost\nhurts to look at. A thundering thunderhead.
The sky's so high, that it looks like it goes on\nendlessly.
The real summer was beginning.
